00054 /*****************************************************************************/
00055 
00058 void ec_domain_init(
00059         ec_domain_t *domain, 
00060         ec_master_t *master, 
00061         unsigned int index 
00062         )
00063 {
00064     unsigned int dev_idx;
00065 
00066     domain->master = master;
00067     domain->index = index;
00068     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&domain->fmmu_configs);
00069     domain->data_size = 0;
00070     domain->data = NULL;
00071     domain->data_origin = EC_ORIG_INTERNAL;
00072     domain->logical_base_address = 0x00000000;
00073     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&domain->datagram_pairs);
00074     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN; dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(master);
00075             dev_idx++) {
00076         domain->working_counter[dev_idx] = 0x0000;
00077     }
00078     domain->expected_working_counter = 0x0000;
00079     domain->working_counter_changes = 0;
00080     domain->redundancy_active = 0;
00081     domain->notify_jiffies = 0;
00082 }
00083 
00084 /*****************************************************************************/
00085 
00088 void ec_domain_clear(ec_domain_t *domain )
00089 {
00090     ec_datagram_pair_t *datagram_pair, *next_pair;
00091 
00092     // dequeue and free datagrams
00093     list_for_each_entry_safe(datagram_pair, next_pair,
00094             &domain->datagram_pairs, list) {
00095         ec_datagram_pair_clear(datagram_pair);
00096         kfree(datagram_pair);
00097     }
00098 
00099     ec_domain_clear_data(domain);
00100 }
00101 
00102 /*****************************************************************************/
00103 
00106 void ec_domain_clear_data(
00107         ec_domain_t *domain 
00108         )
00109 {
00110     if (domain->data_origin == EC_ORIG_INTERNAL && domain->data) {
00111         kfree(domain->data);
00112     }
00113 
00114     domain->data = NULL;
00115     domain->data_origin = EC_ORIG_INTERNAL;
00116 }
00117 
00118 /*****************************************************************************/
00119 
00122 void ec_domain_add_fmmu_config(
00123         ec_domain_t *domain, 
00124         ec_fmmu_config_t *fmmu 
00125         )
00126 {
00127     fmmu->domain = domain;
00128 
00129     domain->data_size += fmmu->data_size;
00130     list_add_tail(&fmmu->list, &domain->fmmu_configs);
00131 
00132     EC_MASTER_DBG(domain->master, 1, "Domain %u:"
00133             " Added %u bytes, total %zu.\n",
00134             domain->index, fmmu->data_size, domain->data_size);
00135 }
00136 
00137 /*****************************************************************************/
00138 
00147 int ec_domain_add_datagram_pair(
00148         ec_domain_t *domain, 
00149         uint32_t logical_offset, 
00150         size_t data_size, 
00151         uint8_t *data, 
00152         const unsigned int used[] 
00153         )
00154 {
00155     ec_datagram_pair_t *datagram_pair;
00156     int ret;
00157 
00158     if (!(datagram_pair = kmalloc(sizeof(ec_datagram_pair_t), GFP_KERNEL))) {
00159         EC_MASTER_ERR(domain->master,
00160                 "Failed to allocate domain datagram pair!\n");
00161         return -ENOMEM;
00162     }
00163 
00164     ret = ec_datagram_pair_init(datagram_pair, domain, logical_offset, data,
00165             data_size, used);
00166     if (ret) {
00167         kfree(datagram_pair);
00168         return ret;
00169     }
00170 
00171     domain->expected_working_counter +=
00172         datagram_pair->expected_working_counter;
00173 
00174     EC_MASTER_DBG(domain->master, 1,
00175             "Adding datagram pair with expected WC %u.\n",
00176             datagram_pair->expected_working_counter);
00177 
00178 
00179     list_add_tail(&datagram_pair->list, &domain->datagram_pairs);
00180     return 0;
00181 }
00182 
00183 /*****************************************************************************/
00184 
00195 int shall_count(
00196         const ec_fmmu_config_t *cur_fmmu, 
00198         const ec_fmmu_config_t *first_fmmu 
00199         )
00200 {
00201     for (; first_fmmu != cur_fmmu;
00202             first_fmmu = list_entry(first_fmmu->list.next,
00203                 ec_fmmu_config_t, list)) {
00204 
00205         if (first_fmmu->sc == cur_fmmu->sc
00206                 && first_fmmu->dir == cur_fmmu->dir) {
00207             return 0; // was already counted
00208         }
00209     }
00210 
00211     return 1;
00212 }
00213 
00214 /*****************************************************************************/
00215 
00226 int ec_domain_finish(
00227         ec_domain_t *domain, 
00228         uint32_t base_address 
00229         )
00230 {
00231     uint32_t datagram_offset;
00232     size_t datagram_size;
00233     unsigned int datagram_count;
00234     unsigned int datagram_used[EC_DIR_COUNT];
00235     ec_fmmu_config_t *fmmu;
00236     const ec_fmmu_config_t *datagram_first_fmmu = NULL;
00237     const ec_datagram_pair_t *datagram_pair;
00238     int ret;
00239 
00240     domain->logical_base_address = base_address;
00241 
00242     if (domain->data_size && domain->data_origin == EC_ORIG_INTERNAL) {
00243         if (!(domain->data =
00244                     (uint8_t *) kmalloc(domain->data_size, GFP_KERNEL))) {
00245             EC_MASTER_ERR(domain->master, "Failed to allocate %zu bytes"
00246                     " internal memory for domain %u!\n",
00247                     domain->data_size, domain->index);
00248             return -ENOMEM;
00249         }
00250     }
00251 
00252     // Cycle through all domain FMMUs and
00253     // - correct the logical base addresses
00254     // - set up the datagrams to carry the process data
00255     // - calculate the datagrams' expected working counters
00256     datagram_offset = 0;
00257     datagram_size = 0;
00258     datagram_count = 0;
00259     datagram_used[EC_DIR_OUTPUT] = 0;
00260     datagram_used[EC_DIR_INPUT] = 0;
00261 
00262     if (!list_empty(&domain->fmmu_configs)) {
00263         datagram_first_fmmu =
00264             list_entry(domain->fmmu_configs.next, ec_fmmu_config_t, list);
00265     }
00266 
00267     list_for_each_entry(fmmu, &domain->fmmu_configs, list) {
00268 
00269         // Correct logical FMMU address
00270         fmmu->logical_start_address += base_address;
00271 
00272         // Increment Input/Output counter to determine datagram types
00273         // and calculate expected working counters
00274         if (shall_count(fmmu, datagram_first_fmmu)) {
00275             datagram_used[fmmu->dir]++;
00276         }
00277 
00278         // If the current FMMU's data do not fit in the current datagram,
00279         // allocate a new one.
00280         if (datagram_size + fmmu->data_size > EC_MAX_DATA_SIZE) {
00281             ret = ec_domain_add_datagram_pair(domain,
00282                     domain->logical_base_address + datagram_offset,
00283                     datagram_size, domain->data + datagram_offset,
00284                     datagram_used);
00285             if (ret < 0)
00286                 return ret;
00287 
00288             datagram_offset += datagram_size;
00289             datagram_size = 0;
00290             datagram_count++;
00291             datagram_used[EC_DIR_OUTPUT] = 0;
00292             datagram_used[EC_DIR_INPUT] = 0;
00293             datagram_first_fmmu = fmmu;
00294         }
00295 
00296         datagram_size += fmmu->data_size;
00297     }
00298 
00299     /* Allocate last datagram pair, if data are left (this is also the case if
00300      * the process data fit into a single datagram) */
00301     if (datagram_size) {
00302         ret = ec_domain_add_datagram_pair(domain,
00303                 domain->logical_base_address + datagram_offset,
00304                 datagram_size, domain->data + datagram_offset,
00305                 datagram_used);
00306         if (ret < 0)
00307             return ret;
00308         datagram_count++;
00309     }
00310 
00311     EC_MASTER_INFO(domain->master, "Domain%u: Logical address 0x%08x,"
00312             " %zu byte, expected working counter %u.\n", domain->index,
00313             domain->logical_base_address, domain->data_size,
00314             domain->expected_working_counter);
00315 
00316     list_for_each_entry(datagram_pair, &domain->datagram_pairs, list) {
00317         const ec_datagram_t *datagram =
00318             &datagram_pair->datagrams[EC_DEVICE_MAIN];
00319         EC_MASTER_INFO(domain->master, "  Datagram %s: Logical offset 0x%08x,"
00320                 " %zu byte, type %s.\n", datagram->name,
00321                 EC_READ_U32(datagram->address), datagram->data_size,
00322                 ec_datagram_type_string(datagram));
00323     }
00324 
00325     return 0;
00326 }
00327 
00328 /*****************************************************************************/
00329 
00332 unsigned int ec_domain_fmmu_count(const ec_domain_t *domain)
00333 {
00334     const ec_fmmu_config_t *fmmu;
00335     unsigned int num = 0;
00336 
00337     list_for_each_entry(fmmu, &domain->fmmu_configs, list) {
00338         num++;
00339     }
00340 
00341     return num;
00342 }
00343 
00344 /*****************************************************************************/
00345 
00350 const ec_fmmu_config_t *ec_domain_find_fmmu(
00351         const ec_domain_t *domain, 
00352         unsigned int pos 
00353         )
00354 {
00355     const ec_fmmu_config_t *fmmu;
00356 
00357     list_for_each_entry(fmmu, &domain->fmmu_configs, list) {
00358         if (pos--)
00359             continue;
00360         return fmmu;
00361     }
00362 
00363     return NULL;
00364 }
00365 
00366 /*****************************************************************************/
00367 
00368 #if EC_MAX_NUM_DEVICES > 1
00369 
00372 int data_changed(
00373         uint8_t *send_buffer,
00374         const ec_datagram_t *datagram,
00375         size_t offset,
00376         size_t size
00377         )
00378 {
00379     uint8_t *sent = send_buffer + offset;
00380     uint8_t *recv = datagram->data + offset;
00381     size_t i;
00382 
00383     for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00384         if (recv[i] != sent[i]) {
00385             return 1;
00386         }
00387     }
00388 
00389     return 0;
00390 }
00391 
00392 #endif
00393 
00394 /******************************************************************************
00395  *  Application interface
00396  *****************************************************************************/
00397 
00398 int ecrt_domain_reg_pdo_entry_list(ec_domain_t *domain,
00399         const ec_pdo_entry_reg_t *regs)
00400 {
00401     const ec_pdo_entry_reg_t *reg;
00402     ec_slave_config_t *sc;
00403     int ret;
00404 
00405     EC_MASTER_DBG(domain->master, 1, "ecrt_domain_reg_pdo_entry_list("
00406             "domain = 0x%p, regs = 0x%p)\n", domain, regs);
00407 
00408     for (reg = regs; reg->index; reg++) {
00409         sc = ecrt_master_slave_config_err(domain->master, reg->alias,
00410                 reg->position, reg->vendor_id, reg->product_code);
00411         if (IS_ERR(sc))
00412             return PTR_ERR(sc);
00413 
00414         ret = ecrt_slave_config_reg_pdo_entry(sc, reg->index,
00415                         reg->subindex, domain, reg->bit_position);
00416         if (ret < 0)
00417             return ret;
00418 
00419         *reg->offset = ret;
00420     }
00421 
00422     return 0;
00423 }
00424

00432 /*****************************************************************************/
00433 
00434 void ecrt_domain_external_memory(ec_domain_t *domain, uint8_t *mem)
00435 {
00436     EC_MASTER_DBG(domain->master, 1, "ecrt_domain_external_memory("
00437             "domain = 0x%p, mem = 0x%p)\n", domain, mem);
00438 
00439     down(&domain->master->master_sem);
00440 
00441     ec_domain_clear_data(domain);
00442 
00443     domain->data = mem;
00444     domain->data_origin = EC_ORIG_EXTERNAL;
00445 
00446     up(&domain->master->master_sem);
00447 }
00448

00450 
00451 uint8_t *ecrt_domain_data(ec_domain_t *domain)
00452 {
00453     return domain->data;
00454 }

00456 /*****************************************************************************/
00457 
00458 void ecrt_domain_process(ec_domain_t *domain)
00459 {
00460     uint16_t wc_sum[EC_MAX_NUM_DEVICES] = {}, wc_total;
00461     ec_datagram_pair_t *pair;
00462 #if EC_MAX_NUM_DEVICES > 1
00463     uint16_t datagram_pair_wc, redundant_wc;
00464     unsigned int datagram_offset;
00465     ec_fmmu_config_t *fmmu = list_first_entry(&domain->fmmu_configs,
00466             ec_fmmu_config_t, list);
00467     unsigned int redundancy;
00468 #endif
00469     unsigned int dev_idx, wc_change;
00470 
00471 #if DEBUG_REDUNDANCY
00472     EC_MASTER_DBG(domain->master, 1, "domain %u process\n", domain->index);
00473 #endif
00474 
00475     list_for_each_entry(pair, &domain->datagram_pairs, list) {
00476 #if EC_MAX_NUM_DEVICES > 1
00477         datagram_pair_wc = ec_datagram_pair_process(pair, wc_sum);
00478 #else
00479         ec_datagram_pair_process(pair, wc_sum);
00480 #endif
00481 
00482 #if EC_MAX_NUM_DEVICES > 1
00483         if (ec_master_num_devices(domain->master) > 1) {
00484             ec_datagram_t *main_datagram = &pair->datagrams[EC_DEVICE_MAIN];
00485             uint32_t logical_datagram_address =
00486                 EC_READ_U32(main_datagram->address);
00487             size_t datagram_size = main_datagram->data_size;
00488 
00489 #if DEBUG_REDUNDANCY
00490             EC_MASTER_DBG(domain->master, 1, "dgram %s log=%u\n",
00491                     main_datagram->name, logical_datagram_address);
00492 #endif
00493 
00494             /* Redundancy: Go through FMMU configs to detect data changes. */
00495             list_for_each_entry_from(fmmu, &domain->fmmu_configs, list) {
00496                 ec_datagram_t *backup_datagram =
00497                     &pair->datagrams[EC_DEVICE_BACKUP];
00498 
00499                 if (fmmu->dir != EC_DIR_INPUT) {
00500                     continue;
00501                 }
00502 
00503                 if (fmmu->logical_start_address >=
00504                         logical_datagram_address + datagram_size) {
00505                     // fmmu data contained in next datagram pair
00506                     break;
00507                 }
00508 
00509                 datagram_offset =
00510                     fmmu->logical_start_address - logical_datagram_address;
00511 
00512 #if DEBUG_REDUNDANCY
00513                 EC_MASTER_DBG(domain->master, 1,
00514                         "input fmmu log=%u size=%u offset=%u\n",
00515                         fmmu->logical_start_address, fmmu->data_size,
00516                         datagram_offset);
00517                 if (domain->master->debug_level > 0) {
00518                     ec_print_data(pair->send_buffer + datagram_offset,
00519                             fmmu->data_size);
00520                     ec_print_data(main_datagram->data + datagram_offset,
00521                             fmmu->data_size);
00522                     ec_print_data(backup_datagram->data + datagram_offset,
00523                             fmmu->data_size);
00524                 }
00525 #endif
00526 
00527                 if (data_changed(pair->send_buffer, main_datagram,
00528                             datagram_offset, fmmu->data_size)) {
00529                     /* data changed on main link: no copying necessary. */
00530 #if DEBUG_REDUNDANCY
00531                     EC_MASTER_DBG(domain->master, 1, "main changed\n");
00532 #endif
00533                 } else if (data_changed(pair->send_buffer, backup_datagram,
00534                             datagram_offset, fmmu->data_size)) {
00535                     /* data changed on backup link: copy to main memory. */
00536 #if DEBUG_REDUNDANCY
00537                     EC_MASTER_DBG(domain->master, 1, "backup changed\n");
00538 #endif
00539                     memcpy(main_datagram->data + datagram_offset,
00540                             backup_datagram->data + datagram_offset,
00541                             fmmu->data_size);
00542                 } else if (datagram_pair_wc ==
00543                         pair->expected_working_counter) {
00544                     /* no change, but WC complete: use main data. */
00545 #if DEBUG_REDUNDANCY
00546                     EC_MASTER_DBG(domain->master, 1,
00547                             "no change but complete\n");
00548 #endif
00549                 } else {
00550                     /* no change and WC incomplete: mark WC as zero to avoid
00551                      * data.dependent WC flickering. */
00552                     datagram_pair_wc = 0;
00553 #if DEBUG_REDUNDANCY
00554                     EC_MASTER_DBG(domain->master, 1,
00555                             "no change and incomplete\n");
00556 #endif
00557                 }
00558             }
00559         }
00560 #endif // EC_MAX_NUM_DEVICES > 1
00561     }
00562 
00563 #if EC_MAX_NUM_DEVICES > 1
00564     redundant_wc = 0;
00565     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_BACKUP;
00566             dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(domain->master); dev_idx++) {
00567         redundant_wc += wc_sum[dev_idx];
00568     }
00569 
00570     redundancy = redundant_wc > 0;
00571     if (redundancy != domain->redundancy_active) {
00572         if (redundancy) {
00573             EC_MASTER_WARN(domain->master,
00574                     "Domain %u: Redundant link in use!\n",
00575                     domain->index);
00576         } else {
00577             EC_MASTER_INFO(domain->master,
00578                     "Domain %u: Redundant link unused again.\n",
00579                     domain->index);
00580         }
00581         domain->redundancy_active = redundancy;
00582     }
00583 #else
00584     domain->redundancy_active = 0;
00585 #endif
00586 
00587     wc_change = 0;
00588     wc_total = 0;
00589     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN;
00590             dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(domain->master); dev_idx++) {
00591         if (wc_sum[dev_idx] != domain->working_counter[dev_idx]) {
00592             wc_change = 1;
00593             domain->working_counter[dev_idx] = wc_sum[dev_idx];
00594         }
00595         wc_total += wc_sum[dev_idx];
00596     }
00597 
00598     if (wc_change) {
00599         domain->working_counter_changes++;
00600     }
00601 
00602     if (domain->working_counter_changes &&
00603         jiffies - domain->notify_jiffies > HZ) {
00604         domain->notify_jiffies = jiffies;
00605         if (domain->working_counter_changes == 1) {
00606             EC_MASTER_INFO(domain->master, "Domain %u: Working counter"
00607                     " changed to %u/%u", domain->index,
00608                     wc_total, domain->expected_working_counter);
00609         } else {
00610             EC_MASTER_INFO(domain->master, "Domain %u: %u working counter"
00611                     " changes - now %u/%u", domain->index,
00612                     domain->working_counter_changes,
00613                     wc_total, domain->expected_working_counter);
00614         }
00615 #if EC_MAX_NUM_DEVICES > 1
00616         if (ec_master_num_devices(domain->master) > 1) {
00617             printk(" (");
00618             for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN;
00619                     dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(domain->master);
00620                     dev_idx++) {
00621                 printk("%u", domain->working_counter[dev_idx]);
00622                 if (dev_idx + 1 < ec_master_num_devices(domain->master)) {
00623                     printk("+");
00624                 }
00625             }
00626             printk(")");
00627         }
00628 #endif
00629         printk(".\n");
00630 
00631         domain->working_counter_changes = 0;
00632     }
00633 }
00634 
00635 /*****************************************************************************/
00636 
00637 void ecrt_domain_queue(ec_domain_t *domain)
00638 {
00639     ec_datagram_pair_t *datagram_pair;
00640     ec_device_index_t dev_idx;
00641 
00642     list_for_each_entry(datagram_pair, &domain->datagram_pairs, list) {
00643 
00644 #if EC_MAX_NUM_DEVICES > 1
00645         /* copy main data to send buffer */
00646         memcpy(datagram_pair->send_buffer,
00647                 datagram_pair->datagrams[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].data,
00648                 datagram_pair->datagrams[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].data_size);
00649 #endif
00650         ec_master_queue_datagram(domain->master,
00651                 &datagram_pair->datagrams[EC_DEVICE_MAIN]);
00652 
00653         /* copy main data to backup datagram */
00654         for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_BACKUP;
00655                 dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(domain->master); dev_idx++) {
00656             memcpy(datagram_pair->datagrams[dev_idx].data,
00657                     datagram_pair->datagrams[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].data,
00658                     datagram_pair->datagrams[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].data_size);
00659             ec_master_queue_datagram(domain->master,
00660                     &datagram_pair->datagrams[dev_idx]);
00661         }
00662     }
00663 }
00664 
00665 /*****************************************************************************/
00666 
00667 void ecrt_domain_state(const ec_domain_t *domain, ec_domain_state_t *state)
00668 {
00669     unsigned int dev_idx;
00670     uint16_t wc = 0;
00671 
00672     for (dev_idx = EC_DEVICE_MAIN;
00673             dev_idx < ec_master_num_devices(domain->master); dev_idx++) {
00674         wc += domain->working_counter[dev_idx];
00675     }
00676 
00677     state->working_counter = wc;
00678 
00679     if (wc) {
00680         if (wc == domain->expected_working_counter) {
00681             state->wc_state = EC_WC_COMPLETE;
00682         } else {
00683             state->wc_state = EC_WC_INCOMPLETE;
00684         }
00685     } else {
00686         state->wc_state = EC_WC_ZERO;
00687     }
00688 
00689     state->redundancy_active = domain->redundancy_active;
00690 }
00691 
00692 /*****************************************************************************/
00693 
00696 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ecrt_domain_reg_pdo_entry_list);
00697 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ecrt_domain_size);
00698 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ecrt_domain_external_memory);
00699 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ecrt_domain_data);
00700 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ecrt_domain_process);
00701 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ecrt_domain_queue);
